greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways the first n cubes can be partitioned into three sets with equal sums.
reference: Keith F. Lynch, Posting to Math Fun Mailing List, Sep 17 2019.
formula: a(n) > 0 => n in { A007494 }. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 30 2019
example: The unique smallest solution (for n = 23) is
maple: s:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n<2, 0, n^3+s(n-1)) end:
b:= proc(n, x, y) option remember; `if`(n=1, 1, (p-> (l->
mathematica: Table[Print[n, " ", a[n]]; a[n], {n, 23, 34}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 08 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 19 2019
ext: a(32), a(33), a(35) recomputed and a(36)-a(38) added by _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 30 2019
